articles.title: Curran: Patriots could ‘explore options’ to potentially upgrade from Stefon Diggs
articles.description:
"It's hard for me to say who's going to be back and who isn't, because you have to upgrade the position instead of just changing it out for the hell of it.”

The post Curran: Patriots could ‘explore options’ to potentially upgrade from Stefon Diggs appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots may consider replacing Stefon Diggs to enhance their roster.
Curran emphasizes the need for a strategic upgrade, not just a change.
Potential roster changes could affect team performance for Boston fans in 2026.

articles.title: Mass. representatives, including minority whip, to skip State of the Union address
articles.description:
The representatives pledged to take various actions in protest, including attending a rally and supporting their direct constituents.

The post Mass. representatives, including minority whip, to skip State of the Union address appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts representatives, including Minority Whip Rep. Katherine Clark, will skip the State of the Union.
They plan to attend a rally to support their constituents on February 24, 2026.
This protest highlights ongoing tensions between local representatives and federal policies affecting Boston residents.

articles.title: Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday?
articles.description:
"I’m not sure when they’ll arrive and hopefully soon because of obviously the flight and the weather conditions.”

The post Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bruins may see Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman return Thursday.
Their return depends on flight and weather conditions affecting travel.
Local fans anticipate their impact on Bruins' performance in upcoming games.

articles.title: Could Trent Williams suddenly emerge as a free-agent target for Patriots?
articles.description:
Trent Williams has earned five All-Pro nods over the course of his standout career.

The post Could Trent Williams suddenly emerge as a free-agent target for Patriots? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Trent Williams, a five-time All-Pro, may become a free-agent target for the Patriots.
Williams could significantly bolster the Patriots' offensive line if signed this offseason.
His addition could enhance the team's performance and playoff chances for Boston fans.

articles.title: Boston ends snow emergency parking ban; residents can use space savers until Thursday evening
articles.description:
“A significant amount of snow was cleared overnight, and large-scale removal began this morning. Crews removed 165 loads totaling 4,620 cubic yards of snow,” Wu's office said.

The post Boston ends snow emergency parking ban; residents can use space savers until Thursday evening appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston ends snow emergency parking ban effective immediately for residents.
Crews removed 165 loads of snow, totaling 4,620 cubic yards.
Residents can use space savers for parking until Thursday evening.

articles.title: With more than 60 inches of snow this year, will the city dump its snow into Boston Harbor?
articles.description:
The short answer is "no," Mayor Michelle Wu's office said. The city's "snow farms" will be utilized to melt the snow accumulating across the city.

The post With more than 60 inches of snow this year, will the city dump its snow into Boston Harbor? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Mayor Michelle Wu confirms Boston will not dump snow into the harbor.
City has received over 60 inches of snow this year.
Snow will be melted at designated 'snow farms' across the city.
